name: Koru Kids
description:
Koru Kids (www.korukids.co.uk) is on a mission to improve childcare in London. It's desperately needed. Did you know that most families with children spend as much on childcare as they do on their mortgage? Or that the average cost of a nanny in Central London is £37,000? Did you know that nurseries aren't much cheaper than that, if you have two children? Did you know that many nurseries shut for summer holidays, and that if your child is sick they can't go for the next 48 hrs?  If you're a parent, you probably knew all of that and more.

Koru Kids will solve these problems, starting with nanny share. We have 1500 families on our platform, and recently concluded a 3x oversubscribed funding round. 

To find out more, check out 
LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/in/rachel-carrell-30ab79/
ITV news: youtu.be/5VdhnKE77Ek 
Evening Standard: http://www.standard.co.uk/lifestyle/london-life/airbnbstyle-childcare-service-koru-kids-could-be-the-solution-for-working-london-parents-a3450191.html

team.name: Rachel Carrell
team.bioHtml: CEO & Founder, Koru Kids - transforming childcare in London. YGL, Rhodes Scholar, ex McKinsey, former CEO of world's largest online doctor service

team.title: Head of Product & UX
team.name: Mark James
team.bioHtml: DREAMS BIG - GETS SHIT DONE - GIVES GOOD HUGS. Head of Product at @Koru Kids, Co-founder of @WEPUL

perks.title: Flexible working patterns, and alternative working arrangements.

jobs.title: Back End Ruby Engineer
jobs.description:
**Back-end Ruby Engineer**

**£50-80k + equity (mid-senior level)**

**About Koru Kids**

Koru Kids is building the world’s best childcare service, starting in London. We’re making it easier and more affordable for families to access high quality childcare. We’re growing like crazy, backed by some of the best investors in Europe, and we’ve won a bunch of awards.

 

**A little about the role**

This role is perfect for an experienced Ruby Engineer who wants to continue to hone their craft in a software, data and content start-up about to enter a hyper growth phase.

We have a mature and stable tech stack and a healthy code-base, built with a strong focus on quality and best practices, which allows for fast design iterations, short development cycles and quick fixes when challenges spring up.

We’re not a deep tech company - we’re providing a tech solution to a complex human interaction problem. Ultimately we are reinventing one of the last essential areas of our social infrastructure that remains largely untouched by technology.

 

**Cool things you could work on**

Helping us scale our public transit time and routing services, enabling lightning quick calculations of transit time between hundreds of thousands of families across London and beyond.

Refining our search algorithms and building tools to make complex ‘matching’ problems a breeze, to give families and nannies a solution that works.

Designing our payroll infrastructure, supporting thousands of individual employee shift submissions every month, ensuring we invoice our families and pay our nannies accurately and on time. This will eventually extend to being a fully fledged scheduling and shift management tool.

## REQUIREMENTS

**A little about you**

- You are a back-end ruby Engineer working on client-facing products (not internal tools)
- You write and ship code in a production environment
- You understand relational databases - MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL etc
- You understand cloud storage, with Heroku preferred
- You are comfortable writing complex SQL queries
- You appreciate the nuances of agile and scrum
- Skills with or an appetite to learn Ruby on Rails or React are a bonus
- Knowledge of AWS may come in handy, as would proficiency with GitHub, CircleCI, Tachyons, Redis, ES6

 

**How you like to work**

- We're a scaling start-up, so you’ll be open to task-switching where necessary
- You value testing, whether test-first or TDD, and advocate clean code
- You're comfortable challenging and being challenged in code review
- You believe in iterating, fast learning-loops and the value of feedback
- You are comfortable working with non-tech people

## BENEFITS

**About the team:**

1. We're hard-working, friendly and kind. If you’re brilliant AND humble, you’ll fit right in
2. Our office is informal but fast paced – we constantly challenge, test and adapt the way we do things
3. We’re committed to integrity, doing the right thing and building a company we are proud of
4. We’re passionate about our mission to create a truly fantastic childcare service to help working parents

 

### OTHER INFORMATION:

- Based in a WeWork in Old Street, you get coffee machines, free yoga classes, a secure bike room & showers.
- Our offices are step-free, and have non-gendered bathrooms.
- 25 days holiday a year.
- As a proud equal opportunity employer we are supportive of flexible working patterns, and alternative working arrangements.
- We are committed to hiring candidates based on business needs, job requirements, and candidate qualifications, without regard to individual’s characteristics or backgrounds.

jobs.title: Business Development Internship - Childcare
jobs.description:
About the role

We need someone to join our team as a Business Development Intern. 
You’ll be responsible for matching our families and nannies together. Most of your day will be spent speaking with families and nannies to help them decide if they are a perfect match for each other.

You’ll have the freedom to experiment and improve the way we do things. We’ll give you all the training and support you need to do the job really well. In particular, you’ll learn advanced techniques to help customers resolve problems and make decisions.

The role is available as a 12-week internship, with potential to extend further. You’ll work full time hours for your time here, roughly 09:30-18:30 each weekday.

You’ll earn pro rata £25k per year.

Start date is ASAP.

About you

We’re after an all-rounder who is clever, practical and nice. You’re empathetic by nature and really love to help people.

We’re looking for recent graduates who are looking to gain experience in a fast paced startup. We don’t mind what degree you’ve done, as long as you’ve done well in it. We’ll be looking for evidence of drive, aspiration and enthusiasm in the extracurricular stuff you’ve done.

Ideally you’ve got previous experience in a customer service or sales role, but this isn’t essential.

You must be eligible to work full time in the UK. 

Essential skills

You’re comfortable speaking to new people, both in person and on the phone. 

Although you like to talk, the most important thing you’ll do is listen. 

You’re detail-oriented. You’ll be working in a complex system, and the details must be 100% correct.

You’re able to write clearly, simply and accurately.

You can work at a fast pace and under pressure. You are comfortable with a degree of chaos.

You’re humble and a fast learner. You’re excited to try new things and respond well to feedback.

You’re nice. You get that no player is bigger than the team. You fit right into our culture of supporting and helping each other, whilst improving childcare in London.

About Koru Kids
Koru Kids is building the world’s best childcare service, starting in London. We’re making it easier and more affordable for families to access high quality childcare. We’re growing like crazy, are backed by fantastic investors, including top venture capitalists and business angels, and have won a bunch of awards. We just raised £10m in our Series A, and were featured recently in the Evening Standard - check out the article here!

About the team

Our culture is friendly and fast paced – we are constantly challenging, testing and adapting the way we do things. We’re also really committed to working with integrity, doing the right thing and building a company we are truly proud of. We’re growing super fast but we also want to make sure that we are building a company on really solid foundations.
If this sounds like a great opportunity to you, then please apply with your CV and a short cover note (that includes details of your availability for the role).
For more information about us visit www.korukids.co.uk

jobs.title: Business Intelligence Lead
jobs.description:
**About Koru Kids**

**£65-90k + equity**

Koru Kids is building the world’s best childcare service, starting in London. We’re making it easier and more affordable for families to access high quality childcare. If you want the opportunity to do irreplaceable work on a unique problem alongside people that will challenge & inspire you; keep reading.

 

**About the role**

As Business Intelligence Lead, you’ll be instrumental in helping us achieve our mission of profoundly improving the wellbeing of one million families in London within 5 years.

Co-leading our Product Insights team with our Lead User Researcher, this team will be tasked with 3 things:

 

1. Help us understand which problems are the most important ones to solve 
2. Help us determine whether the things that we build are having the impact we think they’re having
3. Help us figure out how we democratise 1 & 2 to make product insight self service

 

As an expert in quantitative research, business intelligence and data architecture, you’ll build processes, tools and expertise to help better understand the above. This role isn’t just a query writer and dashboard builder, we’ll be relying on you to help shape the trajectory of the organisation and ensure we truly build the world’s best childcare service.

 

**About the team**

We have a transparent and kind team culture, and are truly mission-driven. We care very much about helping families flourish. We’re committed to working with integrity, doing the right thing and building a company we are truly proud of. We’re growing super fast but we also want to make sure that we are building a company on really solid foundations.

 

**About you**

An exceptionally strong critical thinker, you can rationally prioritise which problems to solve as well as discover how to solve them. You have a strong user focus and passion for user-centred design, and consistently put both users and data before your ego. You understand the balance between being data validated vs data driven. You obsess about how to drive greater positive impact, and maintain clear performance metrics and dashboards. You can show how you set targets and tracked progress against them in transparent, measurable ways.

You love using quantitative analysis to shape product development and influence overall strategy. You’ll be happy communicating and partnering closely with senior stakeholders, the leadership team and Product leads on strategy; as well as getting in the weeds running your own SQL queries.

You have lots to teach others about the value of quantitative research & analysis, and are equally willing to learn from those around you. Emotionally intelligent, you welcome and give honest feedback, especially when it’s hard to do.

 

You’ll have blown our socks off if, in your first 6 months, all teams feel like they have the quant data they need; 95% of releases have empirical, quantitative measures of success; we feel more confident about the longer term strategy; and everyone who wants to get access to quant data says they feel like they’re able to self serve for 50% of their requirements.

 

**Must have knowledge/experience:**

- Lots of experience in an analytical role using SQL, Python, or R working on an analytics, data science or product team, building and automating reporting dashboards, spreadsheet, and presentation tools
- Experience with advanced relational database techniques, ideally on large transactional (not reporting) databases
- Experience managing and/or leading quantitative teams
- Experience collaborating with qualitative User Researchers
- Track record of successful project management, execution, multi-tasking, delegating, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to set goals and lead through vision, clarity, and passion

**Must have skills:**

- Ability to synthesize data into useful formats to drive actionable insights for Product and Operations teams
- Ability to get things done and work independently.
- Ability to understand and contribute to a long-term strategic vision
- Excellent interpersonal, communication, negotiation, and collaboration skills
- Effective data analysis skills in a business context, with the ability to present large datasets in a clear and compelling manner
- Excellent analytical, strategic thinking, and creative problem-solving skills
- Construct analyses around a specific business question, write a clear, usable project plan, and execute with minimal guidance
- Be a thought leader on how to use data to inform the product experience with executive leadership
- *Experience with designing data architecture and warehousing*

**Must have behaviours:**

- You must be nice
- You must be authentic.  We want you to be you, not the “work” version of you
- You must be entrepreneurial. You won’t need a lot of direction. You’re a [Manager of One](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fsignalvnoise.com%2Fposts%2F1430-hire-managers-of-one)
- You must have the desire to look for simpler but better solutions and the ability to do more with less
- You must have an analytical mind that uses empirical data as well as opinions to back up your position
- You must have huge passion & belief in your own ideas, and the humility to embrace being wrong  

 

If we had to sum up your profile in three words, they’d be “Smart, Kind, Creative”

If you’re interested, send us your CV.  Alternatively, send us something else that demonstrates your literary prowess, technical capability, creativity or belief in our cause. Impress us; stand out.

jobs.title: Growth Manager
jobs.description:
**Growth Manager at Koru Kids**

At Koru Kids we’re on a mission to profoundly impact the wellbeing of a million families in the next few years, building childcare technology in London with which we train and provide after school nannies and nanny shares, via our marketplace, app, and EdTech. The challenge is massive, but our team is crazy good. Join us and be part of something truly transformational.

**Here’s your challenge**

We’re looking for someone to make their home at Koru Kids, bringing with them a few years experience of data-led marketing and intelligent growth work, someone who’s excited to make their name in the world of growth and marketing. You’ll operate across every marketing channel going as you work to accelerate the acquisition, retention, and life-time-value wheels of one of our services. The successful candidate will report to the Head of Growth and be responsible for the growth work in their own service area of the business. As a fast-moving business that is on a mission to change the way childcare works you will have endless opportunity to affect and improve the growth of the business. As a fast-moving business though you’ll also need to be comfortable with a degree of chaos, and thrive working with ambiguity.

**You’ll have knocked our socks off in 3-6 months if you:**

1. Set the strategy and performance goals for the growth of your business service, by being deeply into the data, and knowing how all the moving parts are going. You’ll be focusing on key metrics like month-over-month growth %’s, Cost-Per-Acquisition targets, marketplace balance, and overall spend forecasting.
2. Drive those results through ambitious improvements and transformational ideas. You’ll be running your own backlog, and ruthlessly prioritising what’s going to deliver the best return on investment. Every week your team will be testing new channels and approaches, sharing results, and working with our central growth tech resources to deliver effective growth.
3. Help to build a junior team for your service area, whilst being an inspirational leader within the whole company growth team. You’ll be regularly sharing your experiences and best-practice nudges, upskilling your direct reports as well as providing advice or ideas to those working on other service areas. 

**What you’ll be up to:**  

- Adding innovative digital and offline marketing approaches to our backlog, and collaboratively prioritising what to test next, what to scale, and what to turn off. 
- Keeping on top of our metrics and analytics using tools like Metabase, Google Sheets, Google Analytics. You’ll spend time analysing, forecasting, and digging into the numbers and targets super closely for your service area. 
- Making sure our junior team are working on the biggest priorities in the best way they can. You’ll help them grow as growth marketers, and keep their work unblocked. We believe in servant leaders.
- Work with the wider operational team to make sure all our downstream metrics are healthy and our acquisition of nannies and families is balanced and appropriate.
- Making things happen, turning plans into execution, and delivering outstanding marketing for your service 

**Other information:**  

Based in a WeWork in Old Street, you get nice coffee machines, free yoga classes, and a secure bike room & showers.

We offer 25 days holiday and share options.

Subsidised (50% off) Koru Kids nanny for your own family.

As a proud equal opportunity employer we are supportive of flexible working patterns, and alternative working arrangements. We are committed to hiring candidates based on business needs, job requirements, and candidate qualifications, without regard to individual’s characteristics or backgrounds. Our offices are step-free, and have non-gendered bathrooms.

**About the team**

We have an informal, hard-working and kind team culture. We’re all passionate about our mission and are determined to create a truly fantastic childcare service to help working parents. Our culture is friendly and fast paced – we are constantly challenging, testing and adapting the way we do things. We’re also really committed to working with integrity, doing the right thing and building a company we are truly proud of. We’re growing super fast but we also want to make sure that we are building a company on really solid foundations. We take great care with who we hire and all team members are superbly talented and really nice. If you’re brilliant AND humble, you’ll fit right in.

We’re also really committed to working with integrity, doing the right thing and building a company we are truly proud of. We’re growing super fast but we also want to make sure that we are building a company on really solid foundations. We take great care with who we hire and all team members are superbly talented and really nice. If you’re brilliant AND humble, you’ll fit right in.

jobs.title: Lead Ruby Engineer
jobs.description:
** Lead Ruby Engineer**

** £75-90k + equity**

**About Koru Kids**

Koru Kids is building the world’s best childcare service, starting in London. We’re making it easier and more affordable for families to access high quality childcare. We’re growing rapidly, backed by some of the best investors in Europe, and we’ve won a bunch of awards.

**A little about the role**

This role is perfect for an experienced Ruby Engineer with some leadership experience who wants to continue to lead a software team in a start-up about to enter a hyper growth phase. As we grow, we’re looking for someone to take ownership of a team and help shape our engineering culture with the other Lead Engineers and Head of Engineering through process and practice.

We have a mature and stable tech stack and a healthy codebase, built with a strong focus on quality and best practices, which allows for fast design iterations, short development cycles and quick fixes when challenges spring up. You will continue to champion our values and continually drive us to be better at everything we do.

 

You’ll be continuously improving our product, working with your team to build key features that will move the needle in a big way. Instead of an endless product roadmap, you’ll run short development cycles to test assumptions and make smart decisions quickly.

 

We’re not a deep tech company, and we don’t pretend to be.  What is challenging is how we’re providing a tech solution to a complex problem specific to human interactions and behaviours.  Ultimately we are reinventing one of the last essential areas of our social infrastructure that remains largely untouched by technology.

 

**Cool things you could work on**

 

1. Helping us scale our public transit time and routing services, enabling lightning quick calculations of transit time between hundreds of thousands of families across London and beyond.
2. Refining our search algorithms and building tools to make complex ‘matching’ problems a breeze, to give families and nannies a solution that works.
3. Designing our payroll infrastructure, supporting thousands of individual employee shift submissions every month, ensuring we invoice our families and pay our nannies accurately and on time. This will eventually extend to being a fully fledged scheduling and shift management tool.

**A little about you**

 

- You are a back-end Ruby Engineer with experience writing and shipping code in a production environment
- You have led software projects of various sizes in the past, capable of breaking down nebulous problems into manageable pieces with your fellow team members
- You contribute widely to making others better via code review, mentoring and training
- When presented with a complex problem, process or existing system, you are consistently able to reduce the complexity in order to get more done with less work
- You understand that sometimes the way to be most productive is to give your time to your team members
- You’ve worked with product owners/managers to improve ways of working across the whole team

**How you like to work**

 

- You focus your entire team on consistent, sustainable delivery; optimising software for change and minimising the impact of failure
- You understand the business that your code supports and possess empathy for the users of your software; you use this understanding to influence prioritization
- You know the value of short feedback loops at all levels of the software development process from Test-Driven Development, user testing and continuous delivery
- You go beyond simply making decisions by publicising your frameworks for decision making. 
- You understand that a cross-functional team contains people with a wide variety of technical skills and understand the importance of effective communication to share practices and support the entire team
- You make pragmatic choices about tooling, understanding the total cost of ownership of any technical decision

## **About the team:**

We have an informal, hard-working and kind team culture. We’re all passionate about our mission and are determined to create a truly fantastic childcare service to help working parents. Our culture is friendly and fast paced – we are constantly challenging, testing and adapting the way we do things. We’re also really committed to working with integrity, doing the right thing and building a company we are truly proud of. We’re growing super fast but we also want to make sure that we are building a company on really solid foundations.

We take great care with who we hire and all team members are superbly talented and really nice. If you’re brilliant and humble, you’ll fit right in.

 

### **Other information:**

- Based in a WeWork in Old Street, you get nice coffee machines, free yoga classes, and a secure bike room & showers.
- 25 days holiday a year.
- As a proud equal opportunity employer we are supportive of flexible working patterns, and alternative working arrangements. We are committed to hiring candidates based on business needs, job requirements, and candidate qualifications, without regard to individual’s characteristics or backgrounds. Our offices are step-free, and have non-gendered bathrooms.

 

If you are interested in this role, please send us your CV.  Alternatively send us something else - something that demonstrates your technical prowess, creative capability or belief in our cause.  Impress us. Stand out. Email [techtalent@korukids.co.uk](mailto:techtalent@korukids.co.uk)

We are committed to hiring candidates based on business needs, job requirements, and candidate qualifications, without regard to individual’s characteristics or backgrounds. Our offices are step-free, and have non-gendered bathrooms.

If you are interested in this role, please send us your CV. Alternatively send us something else - something that demonstrates your technical prowess, creative capability or belief in our cause. Impress us. Stand out. Email techtalent@korukids.co.uk

jobs.title: Back End Ruby Engineer (100% Remote)
jobs.description:
**Back-end Ruby Engineer**

**£50-80k + equity (mid-senior level)**

**About Koru Kids**

Koru Kids is building the world’s best childcare service, starting in London. We’re making it easier and more affordable for families to access high quality childcare. We’re growing like crazy, backed by some of the best investors in Europe, and we’ve won a bunch of awards.

 

**A little about the role**

This role is perfect for an experienced Ruby Engineer who wants to continue to hone their craft in a software, data and content start-up about to enter a hyper growth phase.

We have a mature and stable tech stack and a healthy code-base, built with a strong focus on quality and best practices, which allows for fast design iterations, short development cycles and quick fixes when challenges spring up.

We’re not a deep tech company - we’re providing a tech solution to a complex human interaction problem. Ultimately we are reinventing one of the last essential areas of our social infrastructure that remains largely untouched by technology.

 

**Cool things you could work on**

Helping us scale our public transit time and routing services, enabling lightning quick calculations of transit time between hundreds of thousands of families across London and beyond.

Refining our search algorithms and building tools to make complex ‘matching’ problems a breeze, to give families and nannies a solution that works.

Designing our payroll infrastructure, supporting thousands of individual employee shift submissions every month, ensuring we invoice our families and pay our nannies accurately and on time. This will eventually extend to being a fully fledged scheduling and shift management tool.

## REQUIREMENTS

**A little about you**

- You are a back-end ruby Engineer working on client-facing products (not internal tools)
- You write and ship code in a production environment
- You understand relational databases - MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL etc
- You understand cloud storage, with Heroku preferred
- You are comfortable writing complex SQL queries
- You appreciate the nuances of agile and scrum
- Skills with or an appetite to learn Ruby on Rails or React are a bonus
- Knowledge of AWS may come in handy, as would proficiency with GitHub, CircleCI, Tachyons, Redis, ES6

 

**How you like to work**

- We're a scaling start-up, so you’ll be open to task-switching where necessary
- You value testing, whether test-first or TDD, and advocate clean code
- You're comfortable challenging and being challenged in code review
- You believe in iterating, fast learning-loops and the value of feedback
- You are comfortable working with non-tech people

## BENEFITS

**bout the team:**

1. We're hard-working, friendly and kind. If you’re brilliant AND humble, you’ll fit right in
2. Our office is informal but fast paced – we constantly challenge, test and adapt the way we do things
3. We’re committed to integrity, doing the right thing and building a company we are proud of
4. We’re passionate about our mission to create a truly fantastic childcare service to help working parents

 

### OTHER INFORMATION:

- Based in a WeWork in Old Street, you get coffee machines, free yoga classes, a secure bike room & showers.
- Our offices are step-free, and have non-gendered bathrooms.
- 25 days holiday a year.
- As a proud equal opportunity employer we are supportive of flexible working patterns, and alternative working arrangements.
- We are committed to hiring candidates based on business needs, job requirements, and candidate qualifications, without regard to individual’s characteristics or backgrounds.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer, Ruby, React
jobs.description:
**Full-stack Developer - Ruby, Rails, React **

 

*Koru Kids is growing quickly. We’re on a mission to improve childcare in London, and looking for someone experienced, creative and friendly to join our* *team.*

### About Koru Kids

Koru Kids is on a mission to improve childcare in London, making it easier and more affordable for families to access flexible and high quality childcare. We are backed by fantastic investors, including top VCs who’ve backed companies like Wonderbly, Thread and Appear Here, as well as the founders of Gumtree and Entrepreneur First. We won ‘Best Technology’ at the Business Women Awards 2017, and are currently shortlisted for a number of awards including Startups ‘Tech Business of the Year’.

### About the role

We’re building a marketplace that enables families to find and share high quality nannies. As an engineer on the Koru Kids team, you’ll be designing and building tech to make complex matching problems a breeze, to give families and nannies a solution that just works, and to supercharge our nanny recruitment and training processes.

You’ll be working in  **Ruby**  for most of the backend, with  **Rails** ,  **PostgreSQL**  and  **Redis**  making up the majority of our core product. You’ll be using modern frontend tooling, with  **ES6, React**  and  **Tachyons**. When it comes to shipping code, you’ll be sending pull requests and doing code reviews in  **GitHub** , and checking that  **CircleCI**  is happy before anything goes live. You’ll mostly be deploying to  **Heroku** , with some heavy lifting on  **AWS**. (That said, our priority is making sure we’re using the right tools for the job and we’re open to adding to or changing up our tech and tooling as appropriate.)

We’re continuously improving our product, building key features that will move the needle in a big way. Instead of an endless product roadmap, we run short development cycles to test assumptions and make smart decisions quickly. We favour feature flags over staging environments and deploy to production as often as we need to; deployment cycles shouldn’t get in the way of delivering value. As an engineer on the team, you’ll work closely with product and operations to find and build creative solutions for business problems and make sure we’re delivering the most value to our customers.

### About you

You’re a mid-level or experienced generalist or backend web developer who thrives in small, fast-moving engineering teams.

**Essential**

- Familiarity with web application development
- Familiarity with relational databases and SQL
- You take pride in writing readable, well-designed and well-tested software
- You’re keen to pair program when appropriate, and generally enjoy a culture of code review
- You’re humble, you lap up feedback, and you want to learn
- You roll with it. You understand that startups are unpredictable environments, and are comfortable with a degree of chaos
- You own it. You take responsibility for your work from start to finish

**Not essential, but nice to have**

- Experience with Ruby on Rails

- Familiarity with front-end development, including modern JavaScript frameworks and tooling e.g React.

- You practice test-driven development

**Any of these profiles could be a great fit**

- Developer bootcamp graduate with at least one year of software engineering experience in industry
- New graduate in Computer Science or related field and a couple of software engineering internships
- Experienced software engineer with a number of years in industry

### Our interview process

- Initial telephone conversation with a member of the team

- Take home coding exercise (1 - 2 hours)

- On site interview involving pairing on the coding exercise and meeting several other members of the team
jobs.descriptionHtml:
*Full-stack Developer - Ruby, Rails, React *

Koru Kids is growing quickly. We’re on a mission to improve childcare in London, and looking for someone experienced, creative and friendly to join our team.

About Koru Kids

Koru Kids is on a mission to improve childcare in London, making it easier and more affordable for families to access flexible and high quality childcare. We are backed by fantastic investors, including top VCs who’ve backed companies like Wonderbly, Thread and Appear Here, as well as the founders of Gumtree and Entrepreneur First. We won ‘Best Technology’ at the Business Women Awards 2017, and are currently shortlisted for a number of awards including Startups ‘Tech Business of the Year’.

About the role

We’re building a marketplace that enables families to find and share high quality nannies. As an engineer on the Koru Kids team, you’ll be designing and building tech to make complex matching problems a breeze, to give families and nannies a solution that just works, and to supercharge our nanny recruitment and training processes.

You’ll be working in Ruby for most of the backend, with Rails , PostgreSQL and Redis making up the majority of our core product. You’ll be using modern frontend tooling, with ES6, React and Tachyons. When it comes to shipping code, you’ll be sending pull requests and doing code reviews in GitHub , and checking that CircleCI is happy before anything goes live. You’ll mostly be deploying to Heroku , with some heavy lifting on AWS. (That said, our priority is making sure we’re using the right tools for the job and we’re open to adding to or changing up our tech and tooling as appropriate.)

We’re continuously improving our product, building key features that will move the needle in a big way. Instead of an endless product roadmap, we run short development cycles to test assumptions and make smart decisions quickly. We favour feature flags over staging environments and deploy to production as often as we need to; deployment cycles shouldn’t get in the way of delivering value. As an engineer on the team, you’ll work closely with product and operations to find and build creative solutions for business problems and make sure we’re delivering the most value to our customers.

About you

You’re a mid-level or experienced generalist or backend web developer who thrives in small, fast-moving engineering teams.

Essential

  • Familiarity with web application development
  • Familiarity with relational databases and SQL
  • You take pride in writing readable, well-designed and well-tested software
  • You’re keen to pair program when appropriate, and generally enjoy a culture of code review
  • You’re humble, you lap up feedback, and you want to learn
  • You roll with it. You understand that startups are unpredictable environments, and are comfortable with a degree of chaos
  • You own it. You take responsibility for your work from start to finish

Not essential, but nice to have

  • Experience with Ruby on Rails

  • Familiarity with front-end development, including modern JavaScript frameworks and tooling e.g React.

  • You practice test-driven development

Any of these profiles could be a great fit

  • Developer bootcamp graduate with at least one year of software engineering experience in industry
  • New graduate in Computer Science or related field and a couple of software engineering internships
  • Experienced software engineer with a number of years in industry

Our interview process

  • Initial telephone conversation with a member of the team

  • Take home coding exercise (1 - 2 hours)

  • On site interview involving pairing on the coding exercise and meeting several other members of the team
